title: Heroic coach disarms and hugs teen who brought a gun into class to kill himself

A heroic football coach disarmed and hugged a suicidal student who brought a loaded gun into school so he could kill himself.

Dramatic footage has emerged that shows the moment Keanon Lowe, 27, wrestled with 19-year-old Angel Granados-Diaz for the weapon as petrified students fled the classroom.

The former University of Oregon football player takes the gun and hands it to another teacher while he wraps Granados-Diaz in a bear hug at Parkrose High School in Portland, US.

The video shows Granados-Diaz in a highly distressed state as both men make their way down the corridor and out of the school building.

No shots were fired.

According to The Oregonian , the teenager, who was 18 at the time and has mental health issues, wanted to take his life after his relationship with his girlfriend ended.

He went into school as he didn't want his mother to find his body in the family home.

His lawyer claimed he had thought about killing himself in the school's bathroom but decided to go to a classroom as someone would call 911 immediately.

Keanon rushed to the classroom after a student raised the alarm saying Granados-Diaz was threatening to kill himself.

He was hailed as a hero for his brave actions.

The day after the incident on May 17 this year Keanon tweeted: “When confronted with the test the universe presented me with, I didn’t see any other choice but to act.

"Thank God, I passed. I’ve spent the last 24 hours being more appreciative of my family and realizing we have a serious problem.”

The footage was released this week as Granados-Diaz pleaded guilty to felony possession of a firearm in a public building and misdemeanor possession of a loaded firearm in public.

He was given three years probation and will be given treatment for his mental health issue.
